title: Add a pre-login demo mode (try-before-sign-in)

requirements.text: Implement a pre-login “Demo mode” so anonymous users can try generating a Birthday Pack without signing in or selecting a plan.

quotes: First add a demo system before login

acceptanceCriteria: When the user is not authenticated, the UI provides a clear entry point to start a demo (for example, a “Try Demo” button in the Hero section and/or Generator section).
In Demo mode, the Generator inputs are enabled and the user can run generator actions needed to experience the app (at minimum: Generate and Surprise Me).
Demo mode uses the existing local generation logic (no network calls required for generation).
User-facing text is in English and clearly labels the experience as “Demo” (or “Demo mode”).

requirements.text: Update generator gating logic so authentication/plan gating does not block Demo mode, while keeping existing authenticated flows intact.

quotes: First add a demo system before login

acceptanceCriteria: If the user is authenticated and has a selected plan, the generator behaves exactly as it does today.
If the user is not authenticated, the generator can still be used when Demo mode is enabled, without requiring plan selection.
If the user is not authenticated and Demo mode is not enabled, existing sign-in prompts can remain (but must not prevent entering Demo mode).

requirements.text: Add a demo-friendly onboarding experience that pre-fills the generator with a realistic example and generates outputs automatically when Demo mode is started.

quotes: First add a demo system before login

acceptanceCriteria: Starting Demo mode pre-fills the form with valid data (including a non-empty Name) and produces a Birthday Pack in the Output section without requiring manual input.
The app scrolls the user to the appropriate section (generator and/or outputs) after starting Demo mode.
The demo data must be generated locally using existing constants and/or existing sample wish data already in the codebase (no external API calls).

requirements.text: Gate advanced/auth-only actions appropriately during Demo mode and show clear English prompts when an action requires sign-in.

quotes: First add a demo system before login

acceptanceCriteria: In Demo mode, any actions intended to be authentication-gated (for example, saving, premium export, or other advanced features already designed to require login) are disabled for anonymous users.

When an anonymous demo user attempts a gated advanced action (or when viewing a disabled control), the UI displays an English message that indicates sign-in is required (for example: “Sign in to download card images.”).
Core demo actions (generating and viewing outputs, and basic sharing/copying if allowed in the demo scope) remain functional offline.

requirements.text: Ensure the Hero section’s prompts and CTAs support the pre-login demo flow in addition to sign-in.

quotes: First add a demo system before login

acceptanceCriteria: When not authenticated, the Hero section no longer presents sign-in as the only path; it also offers Demo mode as an option.
All Hero section prompt text is in English and remains consistent with the premium tone (clear, concise, non-technical).
Existing authenticated behavior of the primary CTA remains unchanged for signed-in users.

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui (Shadcn UI sources are read-only).

Do not edit immutable hook files listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx).
Keep all generation logic local/offline (no external APIs for demo generation).
All user-facing text added/changed must be in English.
nonGoals: Implementing or changing Internet Identity authentication itself.
Adding a backend database or any external persistence for demo data.
Introducing new third-party APIs or services for demo content generation.
